benediction.description: Part of the "actions of the gods" group. Fails if 1 god action has already been performed in the fight. Increases all the caster's stats. The later in the fight the blessing is used, the greater the increase in stats.

boomerangAttack.description: Throws a boomerang that deals damage to the enemy up to 3 times.

boulderTossAttack.description: Average attack that have chances to stun the opponent.

breathTakingAttack.description: Inflicts a small amount of damage but can steal your opponent's breath or slow it down.

canonAttack.description: The precision of this attack decreases on fast enemies. A bonus damage is added to this attack if the enemy is very slow. The enemy has a chance of being slowed down by the attack. Deals more damage if used multiple times in a row.

chargeChargingAttack.description: Attack for 2 turns. During the first turn, the defender's defense is increased by 50 %. During the second turn, the defender's defense is replaced to its initial level.

chargeClubSmashAttack.description: Requires one turn to charge the attack. Delivers a powerful charge the next turn.

chargeUltimateAttack.description: Requires a turn to charge the attack. If the attacker has less than 45% of its combat points, this attack cannot fail. If the attacker has more than 45% of its combat points, the precision of this attack is 70. This attack can only be used once per player and per combat.

concentration.description: Fails if you use this action while you have an alteration. The alteration "concentrated" highly increases the damages dealt by the affected fighter during the next turn.

counterAttack.description: Reply with the same action your opponent just played. Does not work on magical or divine attacks, nor if your opponent did not attack.

cursedAttack.description: Curses the opponent, maybe he will suffer the consequences in the future...

darkAttack.description: Ignores the opponent's defense. More effective against a player with a high attack.

defenseBuff.description: More this action is done, more the defense boost is important.

divineAttack.description: This attack's precision increases with the duration of the combat. It is part of the "actions of the gods". Fails if 2 actions of the gods have already been performed in the combat.

energeticAttack.description: Half of the damage of this attack is restored to the user in health.

eruptionAttack.description: Makes the volcano erupt, spewing molten rocks at players.

familyMealAttack.description: Summons allies to eat the target and poison it.

fireAttack.description: Great chance to burn the opponent. The "burned" status inflicts damage to your opponent over time.

grabAndThrowAttack.description: Throws the opponent if he uses a physical attack, inflicting average damage and having a chance to stun the opponent

guildAttack.description: The players of the guild join together to carry out a powerful group attack.

heatDrainAttack.description: Drains the player's heat, which increases the launcher's attack and freezes the opponent.

heavyAttack.description: The damage of this attack is reduced by 90% if the defender has less defense than the attacker. The enemy's defense is reduced by 25%.

intenseAttack.description: Ignore a part of the enemy's defense. Never fails on a faster enemy. Works better on fast enemies. Forces the user to use the "rest" action in their next turn. Cannot kill the enemy.

lavaWaveAttack.description: Very powerful attack that can only be used as a last resort and inflicts the "Burned" alteration to the opponent.

magmaBathAttack.description: Applies to the launcher. He rests in the lava and recovers his fight points. The number of fight points recovered is divided by 4 after 4 uses.

mimicAttack.description: Randomly copies one of your attacks.

monstrousCopyAttack.description: Copies the attack of a random monster.

outrageAttack.description: Fails if you use this action while you have a state alteration. The alteration "outrage" doubles the attack but lowers the defense. After 2 turns, the effect disappears and the attacker becomes confused.

petrificationAttack.description: Petrifies the target during 2 turns but raises its defense by 200%.

piercingAttack.description: Ignores almost all the opponent's defense. The attacker has a chance to slightly reduce the defense of his opponent.

poisonousAttack.description: Poisons the enemy. The "poisoned" alteration lasts at least three turns and deals damage to your enemy on the duration.

powerfulAttack.description: This attack has 25% chance to do more damage, at the cost of a stun. After 3 uses, the damage is reduced by 70%.

protection.description: Fails if you use this action while you have an alteration of state. The alteration "protected" lasts 3 turns and prevents you from being victim of another alteration while providing a 30% boost to your defense.

quickAttack.description: Never fails on a slower opponent. More your opponent is slow, more this attack will do damage.

rageExplosion.description: Explodes the rage accumulated during the trip on the enemy.

ramAttack.description: If the attacker is not dazed by the attack, he takes part of the damage. The attack can also daze the opponent.

resting.description: Applies to the caster. The amount of fight points recovered is divided by 4 after 4 uses.

roarAttack.description: Lowers the attack and speed of the adversary.

rockShieldAttack.description: Halves the damages of the next attack received.

sabotageAttack.description: Ignores the opponent‚Äôs defense completely. Works better on an opponent with low attack. Attack that costs little breath but that can paralyze the attacker. If that happens, the damages are increased.

shieldAttack.description: Uses the attacker's shield to attack. The alteration "weakened" reduces the attack by 70% for 1 turn.

slamAttack.description: Below average attack that reduces the speed of the opponent.

stealth.description: Discreetly hides to double the damage of the next attack.

stoneSkinAttack.description: More this action is done, more the defense boost is important.

summonAttack.description: Summons allies to help you and attack very hard.

webShotAttack.description: Do a web shot that hurts and slows the opponent.

1.description: A large sandy beach on the edge of the town.
1.name: Sentinel Beach

10.description: An anciently fortified city, Ville Forte is not what it used to be. Ravaged by the old war, only a dozen houses and peasants remain. The rest of the old fortification isn't more than ruins.
10.name: Ville Forte

1000.description: A large beach of black volcanic sand. It takes its name from its very particular color. The first men to set foot on the black beach feared a great curse. This is obviously not the case. Be careful though, the black sand stains your feet and clothes.
1000.name: Black beach

1001.description: A huge forest that covers almost the entire island. Fine particles of ash fall from the Grumble Volcano, which makes the visibility in this forest rather difficult. It is therefore very little explored.
1001.name: Forest of twilight

1002.description: A small village of about twenty houses, partially destroyed, which is located near the forest of twilight. Nobody knows exactly why this village is in ruins. Many think that it is the village of the former inhabitants who succumbed to the lava flows of the Grumble Volcano. But others put forward the theory of a disease, the plague and many rats. There is not a single inhabitant left here...
1002.name: Village in ruins

1003.description: This old abandoned mine passes under the steep path and the mountains. It is so large and labyrinthine that it ends up in the heart of the volcano. It is however difficult to get there. Be careful though, some people would have found old banana remains in the misty mine.
1003.name: Misty mine

1004.description: This path is the only real path to the top of the Grumble Volcano. It is very difficult to use and very dangerous. Many men have died trying to use it. At your own risk.
1004.name: Steep path

1005.description: The centerpiece of the volcanic island, this volcano is still active. It pours several tons of ash per year on this small island, which only grows. The lava that flows in the center of the island is in such great quantity that an underground channel called Lava Channel runs for several kilometers. From the boats on the water, you can see this channel boiling the water in depth. This volcano is said to be the creator of several small islands in the area, such as the Ice Island.
1005.name: Grumble volcano

11.description: True last road which still allows to go around the Mount Celestrum from the north, the Great Road is still widely used, but mainly by brigands.
11.name: Great Road

1100.description: This shoreline is the first thing you see when you arrive on the ice island. It takes its name from the noise the sailors made when they landed. Obviously, they were coming back from the volcanic island where the temperature is much warmer.
1100.name: Cool cool shore

1101.description: As its name indicates, this vast expanse of frozen land is not conducive to rest. Very cold and very dry, there remain however some robust trees.
1101.name: Frozen tundra

1102.description: Large frozen lake, the lake of knowledge is a calm and restful place. You can hear a fine breeze sliding on the ice of the lake. Ideal to meditate after exploring this immense wild island.
1102.name: Lake of knowledge

1103.description: A very large plain where many snowmen are built. Who created the first snowman? Nobody knows. It's far too cold for them to melt. However, some travelers have fun creating new ones.
1103.name: Snowmen plain

1104.description: A magnificent ice cave. Hundreds of stalactites and stalagmites decorate this cave. A natural light illuminates these ice crystals and gives the impression of thousands of stars. If we forget the hundreds of explorers' corpses that have slipped and impaled themselves on the stalagmites, this cave is of an incredible beauty or of a sadness without name. The crystal cave is a dangerous way to reach for the top of the snowy peak.
1104.name: Crystal cave

1105.description: This cave, very similar to its sister, the Crystal Cave, has a great advantage. It leads to the snowy peak through the depths of the earth. It is a long way on the ice and the rock. It owes its name to the caves that go deep underground and show beautiful ice formations.
1105.name: Cavern heart of ice

1106.description: This gigantic peak dominates the whole island. It is visible from miles around. Very difficult to access, the snowy peak shelters old wooden structures dating from an ancient civilization. The two paths leading to it being very perilous, few people have been able to see these structures with their own eyes.
1106.name: Snowy peak

12.description: A great empty Nordic plain, without much interest.
12.name: The Expanse

13.description: A difficult course. Muddy and wet, the Marshy Road connects the Expanse to the Crab River.
13.name: Marshy Road

14.description: A large lake where families enjoy to round up. The Vacarme river flows to there.
14.name: Mirage Lake

15.description: Mount Celestrum is the dominant mountain in the region. Several kilometers high, Celestrum is visible to all. It is said to be named after the ancient goddess. In addition, only one person managed to climb to the top. The only thing that is remembered is these initials: M-B.
15.name: Mount Celestrum

16.description: Small and dangerous path bordering the Vacarme river. Be careful not to fall off.
16.name: Wolves Path

17.description: Warm village bordering the Kings' Valley. It is a welcoming oasis for transit travelers.
17.name: Coco Village

18.description: This river owes its name to the noise produced by its strong current which took the lives of many villagers.
18.name: Vacarme river

19.description: Beach created by the strong winds from the Kings' Valley. The Dune protects the Backwoods Plains from heat and gathers water from the Vacarme river.
19.name: The Dune

1999.description: An old wooden boat, it seems to hold up thanks to the repairs of the workers. It is ready to leave and is waiting for your arrival.
1999.name: Boat to leave the island

2.description: A small road that takes you to the countryside from Mergagnan and vice versa.
2.name: Rural Path

20.description: A vast and peaceful plain, for agricultural purposes.
20.name: Backwoods Plains

21.description: A road, very popular with the villagers. Lots of small sellers settle there for a day for making a huge market together.
21.name: Road of Wonders

22.description: Ill-famed forest near Claire De Ville. Howling Woods has a bad reputation. Hideout of many bandits and outlaws, it owes its name mainly from its doubtful practices, hundreds of years ago.
22.name: Howling Woods

22222.description: A test zone for monsters. Should never appear in the game
22222.name: Monsters test zone

23.description: Large commercial city and economical crossroad, Claire De Ville hasn't always been that welcoming. Very poor at the beginning, she managed to quickly develop thanks to its many shops and hostels which offers a great choice to wanderers of the region. Claire De Ville is also known for its calm and its order.
23.name: Claire De Ville

24.description: A very stiff road that leads to Claire De Ville. Everything depends on which way you're following it.
24.name: Climbing road

25.description: Everything is in the name. A river well appreciated by fishmen from Claire De Ville.
25.name: Crabs' River

26.description: A peaceful town on the verge of the Sentinel Beach.
26.name: Seawynne

27.description: A forest on the verge of the Mount Celestrum
27.name: Celestrum Forest

28.description: Entrance to the king's castle, surrounded by a thick wall, it seems to be able to resist all imaginable attacks.
28.name: Castle's entrance

29.description: The reception room of the King's castle
29.name: Reception room

3.description: Huge plain in the West of the region bordered by a large forest and crossed by a large road.
3.name: The Cradle

32.description: The road which leads to the King's castle
32.name: Road to the King's castle

4.description: Huge forest at the South of the Cradle. It is said that many travelers got lost there.
4.name: Oldster's Forest

5.description: A way named after its furrow within the abundant nature at the South of the Oldster's forest.
5.name: Daedalus Path

6.description: A peaceful village known for its welcoming inn.
6.name: Boug-Coton

7.description: Hot sandy desert named in honor of the region's ancient kings.
7.name: Kings' Valley

8.description: A major crossroad that links main paths to the West of Mount Celestrum.
8.name: Crossroads of Fates

9.description: Formerly important trade route connecting the Cradle and Ville Forte, only old chipped pavement remains of the Main Road.
9.name: Main Road

missions.dailyPotionsStock: Buy the whole stock of daily potions

missions.fightHealthPercent_other: Win {{objective}} fights with less than {{variantText}}% of your health remaining

missions.gainRage_one: Gain {{objective}} rage point by defeating wild animals
missions.gainRage_other: Gain {{objective}} rage points by defeating wild animals
missions.guildDailyFromSomeoneElse: Receive a guild daily reward without asking for it
missions.guildHasPoints: Help your guild to get more than {{objective}} guild points
missions.guildLevel: Be in a guild level {{objective}} or more
missions.haveItemRarity: Have an item with a rarity {{variantText}} or better
missions.havePotions: Have {{objective}} potions at the same time
missions.joinMemberOnBoat: Join a member on the island
missions.kingsMoneyValue: Obtain less than 6500 üí∞ in the king's money
missions.reachScore: Get a score of {{objective}} üèÖ or more
missions.sellOrTradePet: Sell or trade a pet to another player
missions.spendGems: Spend gems in the missions shop
missions.tamedPet: Have a tamed or trained pet
missions.travelHours_one: Do {{objective}} travel of at least {{variantText}} hour
missions.travelHours_other: Do {{objective}} travels of at least {{variantText}} hours
missions.wealthyPayForPVEIsland: Buy a trip to a mysterious island at a very high price

potions.47: Potion of the death that kills
